value.title: Azure Portal “How To” Series
value.excerpt: Welcome to our weekly series that highlights specific aspects of the Azure portal so you can be more efficient and productive while deploying your cloud workloads from the portal.

topItems.title: How to build tabs and alerts in Azure workbooks | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In workbooks, you can build complex reports but may need a way to segment information in different sections. In this video, you will learn how to build tabs for sections of reports and how to use Azure Monitor Alerts data to integrate into your workbooks.      Try out these features in the Azure portal:
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/3XY3lYgrRvA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: How to easily manage your virtual machine | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal "How To" series, learn about the new virtual machine (VM) overview experience, including new ways to quickly get started using your virtual machine.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vQClJHt2ulQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: How to use pills to filter in the Azure Portal | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: IIn this episode of the #Azure Portal "How To" series, learn about the new design for pills, how to use them when filtering resources, and how to add and edit pill filters.  Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XyKh_3NxUlM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: How to get a visualization view of your resources | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to easily view a summary of your resources using different visualizations such as how to view all your resources on a map.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/wudqkkJd5E4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Architect API integration in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about using an Azure API gateway to share APIs with partners, and how to use subscription keys to control access to your APIs.

topItems.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure API Management to change an API without rewriting code to enable you to apply a caching policy to a GET operation for quicker response.

topItems.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Protect your back-end APIs from information exposure and implement throttling to prevent resource exhaustion with policies in Azure API Management.

topItems.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to protect your APIs from unauthorized use with API keys and client certificate authentication.

value.title: AZ-400: Define and implement continuous integration
value.excerpt: Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

topItems.title: Host your own build agent in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Work with guidance from the Space Game web team to set up your build agent running on-premises or on an Azure virtual machine running in the cloud.

value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer
value.excerpt: This learning path guides data engineers through the evolving benefits your organization gains with Azure cloud data platform technologies.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Discover how data systems and roles are evolving and explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions using sample business cases.

topItems.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
topItems.excerpt: Explore the broad array of Azure technologies that analyze text or images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data.

topItems.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Azure Static Web Apps is a modern web app service that offers streamlined full-stack development from source code to global high availability.

topItems.title: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps. Use Visual Studio Code to create and run the web app locally.

topItems.title: Publish an API to Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app and API with Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Functions. Deploy your code from GitHub to a staging site using preview URLs.

topItems.title: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps

topItems.title: Create and publish a static web app with Gatsby and Azure Static Web Apps
topItems.excerpt: Use Gatsby to develop and compile a static web app, then deploy it to the web with Azure Static Web Apps.

value.title: Build AI solutions with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Azure Machine Learning is a cloud platform for training, deploying, managing, and monitoring machine learning models. Learn how to use the Azure Machine Learning Python SDK to create enterprise-ready machine learning solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Azure Machine Learning SDK
topItems.excerpt: Azure Machine Learning provides a cloud-based platform for training, deploying, and managing machine learning models.

topItems.title: Train a machine learning model with Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to train a model and register it in a workspace.

topItems.title: Work with Data in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to work with datastores and datasets in Azure Machine Learning.

topItems.title: Work with Compute in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage compute contexts for experiments in Azure Machine Learning.

value.title: Cloud computing basics for developers
value.excerpt: The first learning path in a course on cloud computing for developers from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types. This learning path prepares developers for real-world cloud practice on Azure.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for developers
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover what the cloud is, the history of cloud computing, what types of clouds are available, and how you might use the cloud.

topItems.title: Economics of cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how developers pay to use the cloud and how cloud providers are able to charge for their services. Get an overview of how the cloud is kept secure.

topItems.title: Datacenter trends in cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Datacenters are what power the cloud. Learn what they are, how they work, and challenges in managing them.

topItems.title: Datacenter components
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into datacenters to discover how they are laid out and how computing resources are provisioned and metered.

value.title: Cloud-native security operations with Azure Sentinel
value.excerpt: This learning path describes basic architecture, core capabilities, and primary use cases of its products. You'll also learn about differences and Get familiar with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native, security information and event management (SIEM) service.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Sentinel
topItems.excerpt: Get familiar with Azure Sentinel, a cloud-native, security information and event management (SIEM) service.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure Sentinel and connect data sources
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to deploy Azure Sentinel and connect the services you want to monitor. Then you can use Azure and AI to provide analysis of security alerts.

topItems.title: Threat detection with Azure Sentinel analytics
topItems.excerpt: Threat detection with Azure Sentinel analytics

topItems.title: Security incident management in Azure Sentinel
topItems.excerpt: Security incident management in Azure Sentinel

value.title: Create an enterprise-scale architecture in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore how to create Azure landing zone architecture at enterprise scale.

topItems.title: Introduction to enterprise-scale landing zones in the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure
topItems.excerpt: The Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure provides many landing zone options. In this module, we'll focus on enterprise-scale landing zones.

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture organizational design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture organizational design principles

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture networking design principles

topItems.title: Enterprise-scale architecture operational design principles
topItems.excerpt: Enterprise-scale architecture operational design principles

value.title: Develop IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. The first unit creates the app, the second unit defines a device template for a refrigerated truck. Then, create a programming project, add code to simulate a truck, and communicate with your IoT Central app. The truck is monitored through a custom dashboard.

topItems.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. We build the IoT Central app from a downloaded JSON file, defining all the device capabilities. Source code is also downloaded for the device app. The focus of this module is on creating rules and actions, to respond to certain telemetry input. Rules and actions enable greater automation of an IoT Central system.

topItems.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to manage an IoT Central application programmatically using the REST API

topItems.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
topItems.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from your previously completed "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you controlled a refrigerated truck. Here, in this module, you add continuous data export to both Azure Blob storage and an event hub. You then build a Power BI app to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

value.title: Get started with blockchain development
value.excerpt: Learn about blockchain and development on the Ethereum platform. Discover what skills you need to begin building your own blockchain networks at scale.

topItems.title: Introduction to blockchain on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to blockchain on Azure. See how blockchain allows business partners to trust each other's data without a central authority. You'll also learn a bit about how blockchain works. The goal is to help you decide if blockchain is a good choice for your scenario.

topItems.title: Learn how to use Solidity
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Solidity can help you program smart contracts for the Ethereum blockchain platform.

topItems.title: Write Ethereum smart contracts by using Solidity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to install tools that you can use to develop smart contracts.

topItems.title: Create tokens using OpenZeppelin
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the significance of tokens and how they are used in blockchain.

value.excerpt: Migrate open-source databases to Azure

topItems.title: Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure
topItems.excerpt: "Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure"

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure Database for MySQL
topItems.excerpt: "Migrate on-premises MySQL to Azure Database for MySQL"

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises PostgreSQL databases to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
topItems.excerpt: Migrate on-premises PostgreSQL to Azure Database for PostgreSQL

value.title: Monitor and optimize operational resources in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Configure hardware and server resources for optimum performance after establishing a baseline. Identify sources of performance problems. Troubleshoot using Azure SQL Intelligent Insights.

topItems.title: Describe performance monitoring
topItems.excerpt: Compare Azure and on-premises tools for monitoring and measuring performance. Determine critical metrics. Understand the purpose of a baseline for comparative analysis.

topItems.title: Explore causes of performance issues
topItems.excerpt: Explore the Query Store for tracking down problematic queries. Understand how SQL Server and Azure SQL manage currency by locking and blocking, or by using snapshots. Implement fragmentation checks and defragmentation.

topItems.title: Configure SQL Server resources for optimal performance
topItems.excerpt: Choose the appropriate size and storage options for your Azure SQL databases. Configure server resources such as tempdb. Understand the usage of Resource Governor.

topItems.title: Configure databases for performance
topItems.excerpt: Control database-level configuration options. Explore Intelligent Query Processing. Configure Open Source databases for optimum performance.

value.title: Process and classify images with the Azure cognitive vision services
value.excerpt: Process and classify images with the Azure cognitive vision services

topItems.title: Identify faces and expressions by using the Computer Vision API in Azure Cognitive Services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the Computer Vision API in Azure to identify facial details in pictures

topItems.title: Process images with the Computer Vision service
topItems.excerpt: Use the Computer Vision API to analyze images for insights, extract text from images, and generate high-quality thumbnails.

topItems.title: Classify images with the Microsoft Custom Vision Service
topItems.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how Cognitive Vision Services detects faces, tags and classifies images, and identifies objects.

topItems.title: Extract insights from videos with the Video Indexer service
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the Video Indexer API to upload, index, retrieve insights, and search for content in video files.

value.excerpt: Realize Integrated Analytical Solutions with Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Synapse Analytics enables you to build Data Warehouses using modern architecture patterns.

value.title: Securely connect IoT devices to the cloud
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path to learn how to securely connect IoT devices with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

topItems.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
topItems.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

topItems.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.

value.title: Work with Data Warehouses using Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Work with Data Warehouses using Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.title: Design a Modern Data Warehouse using Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Synapse Analytics enables you to build Data Warehouses using modern architecture patterns.

topItems.excerpt: Design a multidimensional schema to optimize analytical workloads

topItems.title: Use data loading best practices in Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Use data loading best practices in Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.title: Optimize data warehouse query performance in Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: One Dev Question on Azure

topItems.title: The relationship between an authorization request and tokens | One Dev Question: Hirsch Singhal
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Hirsch Singhal a Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains how authorization requests are connected to access tokens and refresh tokens.    For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/active-directory-v2-protocols?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-AzureIdent
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jEEwN7XAtUo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: What types of managed identities exist? | One Dev Question: Arturo Lucatero
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Arturo Lucatero, a Senior Program Manager working on managed identities for Azure resources, explains the different types of managed identities in the Microsoft identity platform.   For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/role-based-access-control/rbac-and-directory-admin-roles
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/OzqpxeD3fG0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: The difference between, ID, access, refresh, and session tokens? | One Dev Question: Hirsch Singhal
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Hirsch Singhal a Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the difference between identity, access, refresh, and session tokens.    For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/access-tokens?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-AzureIdent
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/41vmzPdbfXM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: What types of Azure RBAC role definitions exist? | One Dev Question: Arturo Lucatero
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Arturo Lucatero, a Senior Program Manager working on Azure role-based access control (RBAC), explains the various types of Azure role-based access control definitions.    For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview
